greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = the number of Dyck paths of semilength n with k UDDU's.
comment: Row 0 has 1 term; row n (n >= 1) has ceiling(n/2) terms.
Row sums yield the Catalan numbers (A000108).
T(2n+1, n) = binomial(2n,n)/(n+1) (the Catalan numbers, A000108). (End)
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..200, flattened
A. Sapounakis, I. Tasoulas and P. Tsikouras, Counting strings in Dyck paths, Discrete Math., 307 (2007), 2909-2924.
example: T(4,1) = 5 because we have U(UDDU)DUD, U(UDDU)UDD, UU(UDDU)DD, UDU(UDDU)D and UUD(UDDU)D (the UDDU's are shown between parentheses).
maple: A135306 := proc(n,k) if n =0 then 1 ; else add((-1)^(j-k)*binomial(n-k,j-k)*binomial(2*n-3*j,n-j+1),j=k..floor((n-1)/2)) ; %*binomial(n,k)/n ; fi ; end: for n from 0 to 20 do for k from 0 to max(0,(n-1)/2) do printf("%a, ",A135306(n,k)) ; od: od: # _R. J. Mathar_, Dec 08 2007

T:=proc(n,k) options operator, arrow: binomial(n,k)*(sum((-1)^(j-k)*binomial(n-k,j-k)*binomial(2*n-3*j,n-j+1),j=k..floor((1/2)*n-1/2)))/n end proc: 1; for n to 13 do seq(T(n,k),k=0..ceil((n-2)*1/2)) end do; # yields sequence in triangular form; _Emeric Deutsch_, Dec 15 2007
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := Binomial[n, k]*Sum[(-1)^(j-k)*Binomial[n-k, j-k]*Binomial[2*n - 3*j, -j+n+1], {j, k, (n-1)/2}]/n; T[0, 0] = 1; Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 13}, {k, 0, If[n == 0, 0, Quotient[n-1, 2]]}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 27 2014, after _Emeric Deutsch_ *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 07 2007
ext: More terms from _R. J. Mathar_ and _Emeric Deutsch_, Dec 08 2007
